questions.name: question(summary)
questions.question: Why does the Quran call Mary the sister of Aaron? This creates confusion since her father is Imran and her brother is Aaron, relating to Miriam at the time of Moses.
answers: The Quran uses 'sister of Aaron' as an honorific title indicating lineage from the pious line of Aaron, not as literal sibling reference. Miriam (Maryam) in Arabic tradition is from the same righteous family.

answers.content: It's not literal, for example I'm a son of Adam PBUH it doesn't mean I'm his actual literal son, or for example the children of Jacob etc
answers.author: Sabr

questions.name: question(summary)
questions.question: Who wrote Hebrews?
answers: The authorship of Hebrews is unknown; it is anonymous in the manuscript tradition and debated among scholars.

questions.name: question(summary)
questions.question: Why don't Muslims believe in the Torah when it has higher preservation than the Gospel and Christian New Testament? Why would rabbis change the Torah?
answers: Muslims believe the original Torah was revealed to Moses but was altered over time. The Quran mentions this in Surah Al-Baqarah (2:79): "So woe to those who write the 'scripture' with their own hands, then say, 'This is from Allah,' in order to exchange it for a small price. Woe to them for what their hands have written and woe to them for what they earn."

answers.content: What do you mean by anonymous
answers.author: Disbeliever

answers.content: Him and the companions validated the Qurans that where authentic, how??? They memorized it directly from the prophet Mohammed s.a.w himself. And they went around finding Qurans that didnt 100% have the same writings as there authentic Quran and had all of the manipulated Qurans burned. That is literaly not used as much by Christians anymore because it corners them into a place where the end game is "uthman r.a burned ALL alterd qurans and left one Quran that we still have today.
answers.author: G-hud

questions.name: question(summary)
questions.question: I am not a hadith rejecter, but I want to understand: What makes hadith reliable and why should we follow them? How are they preserved compared to the Quran?

answers.content: There are chains of narration that lead directly back to the prophet Mohammed s.a.w.  its graded strong by diffrent grading methods (for example) if just one person in the chain was a known drunkard or known for lieing it will be graded weak. Look into "hadith science" on youtube for a broader explanation
answers.author: G-hud

replies.content: But even then, how do u KNOW that certain hadiths whether good or bad but predominantly bad were not made for political purposes or gain? Esp in regards to women. We know the ummayads and and abbasids were and are not even today by scholars considered 100% ok
replies.author: Zack

questions.name: Ghadisa
questions.question: Is making dua in congregation praising Allah bida’a

questions.name: xzado
questions.question:
Assalamu alaikum, I hope you can answer my question, this has buggging me 

In Surah al-Baqarah 2:184, there is a known difference between the canonical Qur’anic recitations.

In the Hafs ‘an ‘Asim recitation, the verse reads “fidyatun ṭa‘āmu miskīn” (feeding one poor person), while in the Warsh/Qalun ‘an Nāfi‘ recitation it is read as “iṭ‘āmu masākīn” (feeding poor people, plural).

My question is:

If a Muslim misses a fast and compensates by feeding only one poor person, has he fully fulfilled the obligation according to the Qur’an, or does the plural reading in Warsh require feeding multiple poor people?

answers.content:
we have to really understand what "poor person" and "poor people" stand for

People aren't understanding that it's not about quantity, it's about category in that context. Neither recitation says that one feeding covers multiple days, nor that multiple people must be fed for a single missed day. 

That verse was never describing the quantity of poor people, but it was telling us to feed the poor basically.

The question arises, how many poor people to feed?Well that's where we need to go to Sunnah, because the best interpretation of Quran was prophet pbuhSahih al-Bukhari 4505 explains The obligation is one poor person per missed day
answers.author: Mumin22
